title: What are Tenses
content:
1. Tenses indicate the time of an action in a sentence.
2. They help us understand when the action happens: past, present, or future.
3. Tenses are essential for clear communication in English.

title: Types of Tenses
content:
1. There are three main types of tenses: 
   - Present Tense
   - Past Tense
   - Future Tense
2. Each type has four aspects:
   - Simple
   - Continuous
   - Perfect
   - Perfect Continuous

title: Present Tense Overview
content:
1. Describes actions happening now or habitual actions.
2. Forms:
   - Simple: I eat.
   - Continuous: I am eating.
   - Perfect: I have eaten.
   - Perfect Continuous: I have been eating.

title: Past Tense Overview
content:
1. Describes actions that have already happened.
2. Forms:
   - Simple: I ate.
   - Continuous: I was eating.
   - Perfect: I had eaten.
   - Perfect Continuous: I had been eating.

title: Future Tense Overview
content:
1. Describes actions that will happen.
2. Forms:
   - Simple: I will eat.
   - Continuous: I will be eating.
   - Perfect: I will have eaten.
   - Perfect Continuous: I will have been eating.

title: Uses of Tenses
content:
1. Tenses help convey the timing and nature of actions clearly.
2. They are used in storytelling, reporting events, and expressing future plans.
3. Correct tense usage enhances writing and speaking skills.

title: Common Mistakes in Tenses
content:
1. Mixing tenses within a sentence or paragraph.
2. Forgetting to match the subject with the correct tense form.
3. Misusing perfect and continuous aspects.

title: Tips for Mastering Tenses
content:
1. Practice identifying tenses in sentences.
2. Use tense charts for reference.
3. Write short paragraphs using different tenses to reinforce learning.
